thread.title: Rupert Murdoch suggests Obama isn't 'real black president'
thread.title_full: Rupert Murdoch suggests Obama isn't 'real black president'

title: Rupert Murdoch suggests Obama isn't 'real black president'
text:
Susan Walsh Rupert Murdoch apologizes for 'real black President' tweet 
President Barack Obama participates in a conversation co-hosted by Coworker.org during the White House Summit on Worker Voice in the East Room of the White House in Washington, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. Participants included workers, employers, unions, organizers and other advocates and experts on how to energize a new generation of Americans to come together and recognize the potential power of their voice at work. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh) Posted: Wednesday, October 7, 2015 8:39 pm | Updated: 12:00 am, Thu Oct 8, 2015. Rupert Murdoch suggests Obama isn't 'real black president' Associated Press | 
WASHINGTON (AP) â€” The founder of the global News Corp. media empire, Rupert Murdoch, is suggesting that President Barack Obama isn't a "real black president." 
Murdoch was praising Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson and his wife on Twitter Wednesday evening when he wrote: "Ben and Candy Carson terrific. What about a real black President who can properly address the racial divide?" Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety. You
